greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Unique attractor for (RIGHT then MOBIUS) transform.
comment: Equals row sums of the eigentriangle A143809 of the Mobius transform;/Q and right border of A143809./Q A007554 = the eigensequence of the Mobius transform. [From _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 01 2008]
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Franklin T. Adams-Watters, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to arXiv version]

M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to Lin. Alg. Applic. version together with omitted figures]
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[ MoebiusMu[ (n - 1)/d]*a[d], {d, Divisors[n - 1]}]; a[1] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 58}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 04 2012, from formula *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
